	BridgeHedge Limited is seeking a&nbsp;highly organized, detail-oriented, and professional Administrative Assistant&nbsp;to support daily administrative operations across the executive office and internal teams.

	Provide administrative support to executives and team members

        At BridgeHedge, we build businesses, transform industries, and shape futures. We are a dynamic management services and consulting firm committed to helping organizations unlock their potential and achieve sustainable growth. Through a blend of management consulting, financial advisory, and portfolio growth strategies, we partner with visionary leaders and enterprises to bridge the gap between ideas and impact. Our mission is to empower businesses to scale efficiently, innovate confidently, and thrive in an ever-evolving market landscape. Whether it’s optimizing operations, driving investment growth, or crafting expansion strategies, BridgeHedge stands at the intersection of insight and execution, turning possibilities into measurable success.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location: Ogudu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	BridgeHedge Limited is seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented, and professional Administrative Assistant to support daily administrative operations across the executive office and internal teams.
	This role is essential to ensuring efficient office administration, accurate documentation, smooth communication, and reliable operational supportin a fast-paced, multi-business environment.
	The ideal candidate is structured, proactive, dependable, and discreet, with strong administrative skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.


Key Responsibilities
Administrative & Office Support:


	Handle day-to-day administrative and clerical tasks
	Manage office correspondence, emails, and incoming calls
	Schedule meetings, appointments, and internal engagements
	Prepare, format, and organize documents, reports, and presentations
	Maintain proper filing systems (digital and physical)


Communication & Coordination:


	Support internal communication across teams and departments
	Draft and send professional emails, memos, and internal notices
	Follow up on assigned tasks and action items
	Liaise with vendors, partners, and service providers as required


Records & Documentation Management:


	Maintain accurate records of contracts, letters, and internal documents
	Ensure confidentiality and proper handling of sensitive information
	Assist with document tracking, version control, and archiving
	Support compliance and governance documentation when required


Operations & Team Support:


	Provide administrative support to executives and team members
	Assist with onboarding documentation and staff records
	Support planning and coordination of meetings, trainings, and events
	Track basic office supplies and administrative needs


Hybrid Work Support:


	Support seamless coordination between remote and on-site operations
	Use digital tools to manage schedules, documents, and workflows
	Ensure timely responses and task follow-ups in a hybrid environment


Required Skills & Qualifications
Education & Experience:


	HND / Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, or related field with 2–3 years’ experiencein an administrative or office support role
	Experience in consulting, finance, or professional services is an advantage


Core Skills:


	Strong organizational and time-management skills
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	High attention to detail and accuracy
	Ability to multitask and prioritize effectively
	Professionalism and discretion


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Workspace
	Comfortable with email, document management, and virtual meeting tools
	Ability to learn new systems quickly


Personal Attributes:


	Reliable, organized, and proactive
	Calm and professional under pressure
	Trustworthy with confidential information
	Team-oriented and adaptable


Why Join BridgeHedge Limited?


	Work within a structured and professional corporate environment
	Gain exposure to consulting, investment, and multi-sector operations
	Hybrid work structure with growth opportunities
	Support a leadership-driven, high-performance culture


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV and short Cover Letter to: careers@bridgehedge.org using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

	Handle day-to-day administrative tasks and office coordination
	Manage incoming and outgoing correspondence (emails, calls, documents)

	Support sales and operations teams with documentation and records

	Strong organizational and record-keeping skills

	Full Stack Development: Design, develop, test, and maintain scalable and maintainable web and mobile applications from front-end interfaces to back-end APIs and services. Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code that adheres to modern development practices and coding standards.
	Backend Engineering: Build robust server-side logic and RESTful APIs using Node.js, Express, Python, Golang, and object-oriented PHP. Architect modular and reusable backend systems that support scalability, performance, and reliability.
	Frontend Development: Develop responsive, user-friendly interfaces using HTML5, CSS3, Tailwind CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, and React. Ensure consistency in UI/UX design while optimizing for performance across devices and browsers.
	Mobile Application Development: Build and maintain cross-platform mobile apps using React Native or Flutter, ensuring seamless user experiences and smooth integration with backend services.

QA & Compliance Associate Job at Gamma Mobility




        
    

        
        Gamma Mobility is a mobility-fintech company fueling the dreams of gig workers across Africa. We empower riders and drivers with vehicles and financial services through innovative solutions and strategic partnerships. With thriving hubs in Nigeria and Ghana, we're rapidly expanding and we would like you to be a part of our journey.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: QA & Compliance Associate

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	As Gamma Mobility’s QA & Compliance Associate, you'll be supporting the execution of quality assurance, compliance reviews, audits, and investigations across Gamma cities. The role focuses on operational checks, documentation review, field audits, and follow-up of corrective actions.


Key Responsibilities
Operational Quality Assurance:


	Conduct QA reviews on verification, evaluation, recovery, and collection processes.
	Review onboarding and transaction files for SOP compliance and completeness.
	Validate system records using supporting evidence (GPS, photos, call logs).


Audit Execution & Field Support:


	Participate in physical city audits and inspection visits.
	Conduct inventory, asset yard, and recovery compliance inspections.
	Support fraud investigations through evidence gathering and analysis.


Monitoring & Analysis:


	Monitor dashboards for SLA breaches, anomalies, and risk indicators.
	Flag irregularities, trends, and high-risk issues to the Manager.
	Maintain audit working papers and evidence repositories.


Documentation & Follow-Up:


	Maintain QA checklists, templates, and audit tools.
	Track corrective actions from audits and verify closure.
	Update SOP deviation logs and issue registers.


Key Deliverables


	QA Review Reports
	Compliance Report
	Corrective Action Trackers


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or a related field with 1-3 years experience in audit, compliance, QA, operations review, or risk roles.
	Strong analytical and documentation skills.
	Good understanding of SOPs and operational controls
	Ability to work with data and audit evidence
	Willingness to travel for audits
	Strong attention to detail
	High integrity and objectivity
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines


Benefits


	You would be part of a dynamic startup revolutionizing the vehicle subscription and financial services industry for gig workers in Africa.
	You would be part of a dynamic environment where your ideas are heard and your contributions propel us forward.
	You would work alongside passionate, talented colleagues who share your commitment to excellence.
	You would witness first-hand the positive change your work brings to the lives of thousands of riders and drivers.
	You would enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including a competitive salary, health insurance, and exciting growth opportunities.
